title: Titration curve - particulate beyon equiv point U

content.description:
Refer to the following.

A 50.0 mL sample of an acid, HA, of unknown molarity is titrated, and the pH of the resulting solution is measured with a meter and graphed as a function of the volume of 0.100 M NaOH added.
content.question: Which of the following is the best particulate representation of the species (other than H2O) that are present in significant concentrations in the solution at point U in the titration?

choices.label: Option A shows 3 circles labeled A with a negative one charge, and 3 small circles labeled N a, with a positive one charge. The circles are interspersed and do not touch.

Option B shows one large circle labeled O H with a negative one charge, 2 slightly smaller circles labeled A with a negative one charge, and 3 small circles labeled N a with a positive one charge. The circles are interspersed and do not touch.

Option C shows 2 very large circles labeled H A, 2 large circles labeled A with a negative one charge, and 2 small circles labeled N a with a positive one charge. The circles are interspersed and do not touch.

Option D shows 4 very large circles labeled H A, one large circle labeled A with a negative one charge, and one small circle labeled N a with a positive one charge. The circles are interspersed and do not touch.

content.answer: Option B shows one large circle labeled O H with a negative one charge, 2 slightly smaller circles labeled A with a negative one charge, and 3 small circles labeled N a with a positive one charge. The circles are interspersed and do not touch.

skill.text: 3.B: Represent chemical substances or phenomena with appropriate diagrams or models (e.g., electron configuration).
